the fish using the same technique as you used for the dorsal fin above measure on one side of the fish about 5 5 from the base of the tail pick up 10 stitches in 2 columns add in fin color yarn and work the following rounds pectoral fin round 1 side a k10 side b k10 20 stitches total / 10 each side pectoral fin round 2 side a * k1 kfb * side b * k1 kfb * 30 stitches total / 15 each side pectoral fin round 3 side a * k2 p1 * side b * k2 p1* pectoral fin round 4 side a * kfb k1 p1 * side b * kfb k1 p1 * 40 stitches total / 20 each side pectoral fin round 5 side a * k1 p1 * side b * k1 p1* pectoral fin divide & finish if you want to add stuffing pause about 3/4 of the way across this row add your stuffing and then finish binding off divide stitches evenly 20 on each onto 2 needles with wrong sides together do a 3 needle bind off repeat pectoral fin on the other side i usually poke a dpn through from one side to the other to make sure i m starting the pectoral fin on the other side in the same spot the eyes you are pretty much on your own for the eyes i haven t perfected this yet for older kids you can sew on a button the hats i ve made so far have been made primarily for
